smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found in the PDF; each labeled diagram page appears to contain elements or listed contents.

On the use case diagrams (pages 2 and 3), the presence or absence of actor associations is not explicitly and unambiguously visible from the provided content; no clearly isolated use case oval without any actor association is explicitly indicated. Text lists on the package/overview page were not evaluated under this rule.

No pairs of use cases with names clearly describing the same activity and associated with the same actor were explicitly visible on the use case diagrams; the listed use case names on pages 2 and 3 appear distinct.

On the package diagram page 1, within the textual list for the Klassifikaatorite register, the element name 'Auto_mark' appears twice in the same package list, indicating multiple model elements with the same primary name in that package.

No explicit evidence was visible of two or more tables storing redundant copies of the same data value without a foreign key connecting them; repeated generic columns such as names or identifiers were not clearly shown to represent denormalized duplicates.

Within each use case diagram, the use case names appear consistently verb-led (e.g., 'Tuvasta kasutaja', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid', 'Registreeri auto', 'Muuda autot'), so no inconsistent naming form was explicitly visible.

The state diagram on page 9 lists states such as Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Lõpetatud and Unustatud, but unreachable states are not explicitly and unambiguously indicated from the visible content.
The activity diagram on page 4 does not explicitly show any action that is clearly unreachable; reachability issues were not unambiguously visible.

Class diagram relationships shown in the parsed content include multiplicities (e.g., 1, 0..*, 0..1) on pages 5, 6, 10, 12 and 13, and the database-style diagrams (pages 14-19) use FK-style connectors that are exempt; no UML-style relationship line was explicitly visible without multiplicity indicators at both ends.

No single analyzed diagram clearly displays 10 or more central elements. The use case diagrams appear to show fewer than 10 use cases, and the class/state/activity diagrams do not unambiguously exceed the threshold based on visible elements.

No single class or table was explicitly shown with 6 or more distinct visible relationship lines on any one class or database diagram page; the number of separately drawn connectors cannot be confirmed as meeting this threshold from the provided content.

The PDF content does not provide explicit, measurable evidence that the distance between two related elements is more than twice the average distance on any diagram; no clear layout-based violation was visible.

The activity diagram on page 4 includes action labels such as 'Otsimine' and 'Valimine' that appear to be nouns rather than active-verb starts, indicating at least one activity action name that does not start with an active verb.

No class, table, attribute, or use case names of 3 or fewer characters were clearly visible as actual element names; apparent short tokens like PK, FK, or id-like markers appear as notation or metadata rather than names of model elements.
Class names visible in conceptual and register class diagrams (e.g., Isik, Töötaja, Auto, Klient, Klassifikaator, Kasutajakonto) start with uppercase letters and do not clearly appear plural.

Attribute and column names shown in the class and database diagrams appear to start with lowercase letters; uppercase prefixes visible alongside columns are part of PK/FK notation rather than the attribute/column names themselves.
Database table names visible on pages 14-19 (e.g., Isik, Kasutajakonto, Klient, Auto, Riik, Auto_kategooria) do not clearly appear plural.

No class, table, attribute, or use case names were explicitly visible with disallowed type-indicating prefixes or abbreviations such as 'tbl_', 'uc_', or 'str'; allowed PK_/FK_-style prefixes appear only in constraint or key notation.
